candidates.body:
Bumped versions for 1.20.5

Please ensure:
- [x] Crate versions are bumped correctly
- [x] deno_std version is incremented in the code
- [x] Releases.md is updated correctly

To make edits to this PR:
```shell
git fetch upstream release_1_20.5 && git checkout -b release_1_20.5 upstream/release_1_20.5
```

cc @dsherret

candidates.title: refactor(cli/lsp): migrate from lspower back to tower-lsp
candidates.body:
<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read http://deno.land/manual/contributing

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(std/http): Fix race condition in server
    - docs(console): Update docstrings
    - feat(doc): Handle nested reexports

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. Ensure there is a related issue and it is referenced in the PR text.
3. Ensure there are tests that cover the changes.
4. Ensure `cargo test` passes.
5. Ensure `./tools/format.js` passes without changing files.
6. Ensure `./tools/lint.js` passes.
-->

Rework of #14059 

closed: #14056

candidates.title: chore(tests): add more lsp tests for formatting
candidates.body: Tests for #14148.

candidates.title: chore(tests): use custom temp dir creation for the tests
candidates.body:
This makes the tests way faster on Windows (at least on my machine). My WSL seems unaffected at 1m 46s on main.

Before: 11m 51s
After: 2m 26s

Also, fixes various temp directories that weren't being cleaned up.

candidates.title: chore: upgrade dprint-core to 0.54.1
candidates.body: Upgrades to the new API. This actually has some perf improvements and a bug fix that won't matter to most people.

candidates.title: fix(task): handle `PATHEXT` with trailing semi-colon
candidates.body: ref: https://github.com/denoland/deno_task_shell/pull/28

candidates.title: chore: update clap and completions
candidates.body:
Updates clap, clap_complete, and clap_complete_fig. `clap::App`, `clap::AppSettings` and `clap::ArgSettings` are deprecated and have been changed to `clap::Command` + the relevant methods.

One test had to be changed due to an updated error message from Clap.

<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read http://deno.land/manual/contributing

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(std/http): Fix race condition in server
    - docs(console): Update docstrings
    - feat(doc): Handle nested reexports

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. Ensure there is a related issue and it is referenced in the PR text.
3. Ensure there are tests that cover the changes.
4. Ensure `cargo test` passes.
5. Ensure `./tools/format.js` passes without changing files.
6. Ensure `./tools/lint.js` passes.
-->

candidates.title: chore: update rusqlite

candidates.title: Release 1.20.2
candidates.body: Contains release commits from v1.20 branch for 1.20.2.

candidates.title: chore: drop src/ in bench_util & serde_v8
candidates.body: To align with conventions used in our other crates

candidates.title: experiment(serde_v8): derive_more enabled opaque wrappers
candidates.body:
Experiment using [derive_more](https://docs.rs/derive_more/latest/derive_more/) to help generate magic-type wrappers with mostly opaque-ish internal types, so we can swap out Vec for SmallVec for ByteStrings. Creating them via Into/From rather than explicitly wrapping their internal type.

(Note that's just as efficient, `SmallVec`s can be created from Vec's with no copying, it simply transfers ownership of the buffer on the heap)

candidates.title: fix(unstable): upgrade deno_task_shell to 0.2
candidates.body: Changelog: https://github.com/denoland/deno_task_shell/releases/tag/0.2.0 (has some `feat`s in it, but this is unstable so categorizing this PR as a fix so it gets in the next patch)

candidates.title: fix: cargo publish fails without absolute paths
candidates.body:
https://github.com/denoland/deno/commit/4e3ed37037a2aa1edeac260dc3463a81d9cf9b88 was erroneous and broke `cargo publish`.  I've opened https://github.com/denoland/deno/issues/13994 that would allow us to catch errors like this in the future.

1.20.1 will be released after this is landed.

candidates.title: feat(task): add unstable warning to `deno task`
candidates.body: Moving `deno task` to unstable. This will allow us to validate the approach before stabilizing it.

candidates.title: chore(test_util): use pretty_assertions when not pattern matching
candidates.body: If the assertion string doesn't contain "[WILDCARD]" then it uses `pretty_assertions::assert_eq` for better output.
